[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Benedetto.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Russo, are you blinking?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Are you all set?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Russo.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Well, it would be more of an overtime issue.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's NMLAC, so our police department works in combination with other police communities that we're a member of.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And they all come in, and they bring their various dogs and whatnot.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we incur overtime if it's above and beyond our office's time.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But we don't pay for the other communities.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So it depends on what time, when you're doing it, and who's on staff that day.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mayor Burke.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Benedetto.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yeah, highlight the survey, because you had some decent results.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I know, you're just not coming across loud, but you are on.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We'll close it.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Okay.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're down to our last item, negotiations and legal matters.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And this is the discussion of upcoming employee negotiation strategies, discussion of security strategies and discussion of employee complaint under mass general law chapter 38 section 21 a one.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a motion to go into executive session by Mr. Ruggiero seconded by Mr. Russo roll call vote.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Kreatz.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes, seven in the affirmative, zero in the negative.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion passes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will now enter executive session and we will convene.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We'll come out of executive session to complete the meeting.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will not reconvene in this room.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you so much for remaining here for this very important matter that we just took under consideration for multiple hours.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And at this point in time, I'd like to announce what the committee has adopted in executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Effective April 30th, mutually, the superintendent will retire from the city of Medford public schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He shall coordinate any and all security issues with the chief of police or his designee going forward.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: No administrative, principal, personnel appointments or non-contractual salary adjustments without the approval of the school committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And after April 30th, this committee will contract with the current superintendent for budget and transition up to 25 hours a week at its current hourly rate.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Also, while we were in committee, we discussed many other items that are germane to this conversation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: First and foremost, we believe that there should be a director of security for public buildings, and we will do everything we can to work with the city council in order to do so.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That will take consideration of the school department buildings as well as the city buildings that we maintain.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will work on enhanced communication protocols with our community relations subcommittee that Mr. Ruggiero is the chair of.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will move forward on ALICE training.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will establish a school safety advisory committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will publicize the tip line that we currently have in place for our police department that can be utilized for other matters.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we really want the students at Medford High to be aware of that tip line so that they can use it if they see fit.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will pursue a security audit of the schools in conjunction with the city council.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I believe that takes care of all the matters that we discussed in executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: There's a motion on the floor for approval of this.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Seconded.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Seconded by Mrs. Kreatz.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Roll call vote please.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: 5 in the affirmative, 2 in the negative.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The motion passes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Also, as people are aware, we had an incident report policy that was in place.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have worked over the last few days with both our deputy superintendent and our assistant superintendent and the superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: to really beef this policy up.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the school committee was just given this tonight.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So there hasn't been a lot of time to look at it.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But we really feel strongly that something needs to be put in place.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So this may be a starting point.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And over the course of the next few meetings, should we need amendments to this policy, certainly we will entertain them.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But at this point, we want to get a very strong policy in place that captures some of the

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: some of the items that may have transpired.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I know that Mr. Russo will have an amendment, but basically we've set up this incident report policy with the following definitions.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Discovery.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It has three pillars, discovery, notification, and disposition.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Discovery, finding any object or observing any situation that applies to the safety and security of the school and or school district, which would negatively impact the well-being of students, faculty, and staff.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Notification, verbal and or written communication to the appropriate authority, including but not limited to the police department.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Disposition, reporting of actions taken and conclusions reached that describe and explain the nature of the threat and or behavior identified, as well as any recommendations that emerge from the investigation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So the policy, the draft policy that's before us tonight reads, any individual discovers an item including but not limited to weapons, ammunition, explosives, drugs, any contraband items shall notify the Medford Police Department immediately and inform the principal.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If the principal cannot be reached, the individual who discovers the item should notify the superintendent of schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This process will be in effect on a 24 hours a day, seven days a week basis.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As soon as possible, the principal shall prepare written reports surrounding the incident and submit to the superintendent of schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The school administration will promptly notify parents of situations that may affect the well-being of students, faculty, and staff.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: These notifications will be done consistent with applicable law, regulations, and policies of the Medford Public Schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Additionally, principals are required to immediately notify the office of the superintendent of schools about other incidents, including but not limited to accidents, fires, and suspension expulsion of students.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Written reports concerning the incidents must be submitted to the superintendent no later than the next day following the incident.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The principal or his or her designee must also notify the mayor and members of the school committee as soon as possible.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Finally, upon disposition of the investigation, Superintendent, in conjunction with the Police Department, will provide an appropriate written report to the Mayor, School Committee, and Principal.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This report shall include the facts surrounding the situation, conclusions reached, as well as any recommendations to be considered.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Russo, I believe you had an amendment to that?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion of approval.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: There's a motion on the floor as amended.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a second?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Second by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mustone.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Roll call vote please on this policy.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: 7 in the affirmative, 0 in the negative.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The motion passes, policy adopted.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And finally, I just want to say that

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We did not take this decision lightly.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We considered all different perspectives on this matter.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also considered the multiple years of service that this superintendent has provided to this community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He has been a leader in our educational community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He has built new schools for this community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He has enhanced so many opportunities in our school system.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We do not take those things lightly.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And he has always been a stalwart in everything that has been good about our system and will continue to be.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a lot.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a lot of important matters that are before us.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a transition that we've already announced for our new superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The search committee has been meeting in the other room all evening, starting the process without the three members of the school committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we are moving forward in that process.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have contract negotiations.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have the closeout of the school year, as well as the budget for the subsequent year.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a lot of things that we have to move forward in this community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And above and beyond all of that is the safety of our students as well as the teachers and everyone that works in our school system.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That is our top priority to move forward.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we have to do this as a community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I know that there are other members of this body that would like to say a few words because this has probably been one of the most difficult week and a half that I think most of us have had.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there anyone that would like to?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Vandekloot?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Ruggiero.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Benedetto.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Russo.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Oh, yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I just wanted to make a very quick comment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I had the privilege to stand next to some amazing teachers today at the McGlynn School, and administrators, and staff.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And everyone stood so tall today for the benefit of our children.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And if you just spent a few minutes there, you would have seen it in action.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And they're some amazing people.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And they're not just at our McGlynn School.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They're in all of our schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a wonderful school community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They're caring, they're nurturing, and they put their children first, all of our children first.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And so to them and to all of you who are here tonight that represent them, I thank you personally for all of your hard work.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We know this has been difficult for you as well.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we are here to support you and to move this community forward.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And just thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you all.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to adjourn.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to adjourn.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will establish a school safety advisory committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Update report on enrollments with information on 100 unit school-age students.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So this is basically a report that details the enrollment numbers we have in some of our larger housing developments, whether they be rental or owned.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So this included 48 Forest Street, which has been on our books for decades, 3920 Mystic Valley Parkway, 100 Station Landing, 39th Street, which has zero students, and 12 to 28 9th Street, both condominium developments that have been in the city of Medford for, I

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Maybe more.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So those new ones were 27, 28 students from those developments.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: By Mrs. Kreatz and seconded by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Van der Kloot.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Kuchar.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And that's more just to go over that it is the meetings start out in public session and then they go into executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If word gets out on who candidates are or the discussions that are taking place, that person will be removed from this committee if people find out that's sanctity of the executive session until it is determined

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: the candidates that are going to be recommended to the full body.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: law to keep it into executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And also Massachusetts Association of School Committees, Mr. Kuchar will be holding focus groups the following week.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I believe that is the 15th of March, of February.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I can go through some of the key dates that we've established for our timetable.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So February 7th is the search committee orientation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: February 15th, focus groups for parents, guardians, and to anyone else really.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And he'll also be going to the various schools to talk to teachers, administrators, to determine what do they think about this whole process and how would they like to see it played out.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At the orientation, Mr. Kuchar is going to tell the committee basically certain questions that they can ask and certain questions that they're not allowed to ask, such as discriminatory questions.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And also ask the members to try and figure out what questions they would like to ask.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And those questions should be submitted to me by February 25th.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I can give you all a copy of the timeline.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: February 28th is the actual application due date for those interested in applying to be a superintendent in the city of Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And then on March 1st, Mr. Kuchar and his team will be reviewing all of the applications and actually submitting to the search committee

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: His recommendations, a rating system of the applicants, and that's just a recommendation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The search committee itself will determine if we want to follow with his recommendations and or include anyone else in the interview process.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Interviews are scheduled the week of March 10th to the 20th with hopefully recommendations to the school committee of the finalists by March 21st.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So it's a very aggressive timeline.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Everyone that filled out a form made note if they were available or not.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In some cases, some people weren't considered because they weren't going to be available during key pieces of this whole puzzle.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So unfortunately, it had to be limited.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we discussed that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That'll be discussed in greater detail later on.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also talked about the superintendent search.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If I could try to go through this.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Member Van der Kloot expressed the following.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: She made a motion during our meeting that due to the number of unexpected internal local candidates, potentially there's only two persons.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Since we all want the best options, we should consider opening the search to external candidates as well.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Rather than a two-tiered search, the school committee should conduct one full search, which would include both internal and external candidates.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We voted during the committee meeting to adopt that, and that is the way we are moving forward.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also had the McGlynn PTG Issue that came into our committee of the whole and we heard from the committee treasurer Jane Wright In regards to the various topics that were discussed both in the press as well as in social media And we moved that the school committee adopt some policies and procedures which will be discussed later on in our meeting as well But found that there were no

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: No issues with the actual financials of the PTG during the period that was in question.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: During our subcommittee meeting on the superintendent search, we also looked over the application form, which we approved.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We approved a survey that the committee had been charged with putting together that will go out to survey a monkey at some point.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also voted to utilize the Mass.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Association of School Committees to be our administrative arm for the search.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I actually met with them this afternoon, and they are aware of everything that we did.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We'll be sending them

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I have a litany of dates that I could list to you, although I'd rather type them up and get them typed tomorrow and I'll circulate them.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But the search committee orientation, we're looking to start on February 7th.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As you know, we did a press release today including a copy of the application for those that are interested from the public to apply to be on the search committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Report of superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Report on MASC participation in superintendent search.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At this time, I really would like to thank the committee that got together to put together this survey, led by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Vandekloot, Mr. Russo, Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Kreatz, formerly Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Cuno, also served prior to January, along with Jenny Graham, a parent who stepped up and actually put the brochure together, a really nice-looking brochure demonstrating the strengths of our community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I just want to thank all of you for your hard work in such a tight little time frame.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And if you do have any of the documents, including the survey, if you could get it to us so that we can get it to Glenn.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So he can start to get them formalized and out the door.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He's going to actually put together focus groups for not only the citizenry at large, but also internally for teachers and administrators.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will not be at the administrative meeting, because they like to kind of do things with just him.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But we certainly, he will be putting something on for the public, as well as the school committee, and the ultimate search committee as well, to say like the do's and the don'ts.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If certain questions are legal, you cannot ask.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So everyone needs to be apprised of that and stick to that, because it's a discriminatory practice.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So he will give us all guidance as we move along.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And tomorrow, I'll have a group of dates that shows when we think we're going to hit these milestones.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: OK.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good, is there a motion to accept this report and place it on file?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: VanderBloom.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All registered organizations must submit bylaws, names of officers and board members, and then it says annual fundraising and expenditure plans, if that could just be an annual budget.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And at the end,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: in a year-end financial statement, including the Form 990 and state filings.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I, I, Stephanie Mutini Burke, do solemnly swear, do solemnly swear, that I will faithfully and impartially, that I will faithfully and impartially, discharge and perform, discharge and perform,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you so much.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Happy New Year, everyone.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Welcome to the Honorable Governor Baker, Senator Markey, all elected officials, clergy, family, and friends here today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Congratulations to the elected officials taking their oath of office this morning, especially to those newly elected.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: May our oaths be indicative of a common commitment to present our varied viewpoints with civility and willingness to listen.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That is the hallmark of democratic discourse.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Two years ago in this same theater, I began my administration with a call to service by saying, it starts today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Certainly within this call was a recognition of past accomplishments, but it was also a reminder to our residents that we are embarking on a fresh start, a new vision, and an invitation to creativity as we work together for the good of our precious Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Much has been done.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The building blocks of a better tomorrow have been put in place.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We stand on a firm foundation of open government and a willingness to work cooperatively so that change is made where change is needed, and we can foster a future that is both fluid and deliberate.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation centered on planning, such as the master plan for Medford Square.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This plan was crafted with the input of many.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It will showcase and embrace our historic Mystic River and is aimed at enhancing and refreshing our downtown area in many ways.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: including taking steps to address traffic flow so that High Street, Riverside Ave, and Salem Street no longer become a slingshot to get to the other side, but the center of our city to be repurposed to serve the businesses and the residents of the square.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The plan is challenging, but my administration is up to execute this plan and will work in full collaboration with the city council, stakeholders, and developers to create a dynamic mixed-use area.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation characterized by prioritized investment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We continue to progress through the City's five-year capital plan.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Working with the City Council, my administration has systematically invested in the City's infrastructure and equipment needs.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At the center of this investment is a new police headquarters.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The team has been meeting weekly to develop the layout, space needs, and features for this state-of-the-art facility.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Their hard work continues and we are growing closer to having a schematic design and then the demolition.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This resilient project will be solar ready and meet the high demands of attempting to be carbon neutral.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation enhanced by collaboration.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Governor Baker initiated an office called Open for Business.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: With the assistance of this office, a parcel of state land along Mystic Avenue has been made available for development.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Assistance of this type will greatly aid the City of Medford to create a Mystic Ave corridor that we can rightly call the gateway to Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Consistent with this effort, the city has received a grant from the Metropolitan Area Planning Council and Mass Housing to assist in drafting a zoning amendment that will take into consideration the current businesses along the corridor and make recommendations to reshape zoning to allow for development that fosters responsible growth and at the same time acknowledges and preserves the residential character of our city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Of course, the city council will play a pivotal role in this action, and I look forward to this collaboration.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In the same way, I have committed, along with the metropolitan mayors and our governor, to embrace housing initiatives and significantly increase the residential housing stock in our city and the metro region.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Medford is the place to live.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation that is based on results.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But change requires more than words.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It requires work that bears results.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This very day, the Chevalier Theater will host its first performance under the stewardship of Bill Blumenreich Presents.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This is the result of months of collaboration between the administration, the city council, the Chevalier Auditorium Commission, the licensing commission, and our state delegation, and so many others, all working toward the goal of utilizing our beautiful theater

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: to raise the profile of the arts and benefit the life of our downtown businesses.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation that is comprehensive.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I am very proud of our Complete Streets program, with the assistance of the Governor's Office once again.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They have been fabulous to the City of Medford, I might say.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We've put an emphasis on multimodal transportation and it is being implemented as we speak.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: To date, we have completed four projects from the priority list.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The most visible are on High Street in West Medford and the Winthrop Circle.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Through this program, pedestrians and bicycle access has been and will continue to be addressed in every municipal road project in the community and also private projects that come into our city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For this, we say thank you, Governor Baker.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He claims to be a Republican, but I don't really know for sure.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a firm foundation whose key ingredient is the dedication of its public servants.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Bricks, mortar, infrastructure and the needs of public safety will always be central municipal concerns.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But these concerns are addressed by real people.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They are people who serve day in and day out.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Many are with us today and I thank you for your dedication, the department heads of the City of Medford and those employees that are here today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In this new year, we will experience the retirement of two key figures in our city government.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Our esteemed Superintendent of Schools, Roy Belson.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And our respected Chief of Police, Leo Badisacco.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Both of these individuals have devoted their entire professional careers to serving the citizens of Medford, and they have both set and met extraordinary high standards.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They are leaders of vision and mentors to their department.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: To them, we say with all our heart, thank you so very much.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I also want to say a word about our women and men who participate in our senior tax abatement program, led by the Vivian Wright, who's in attendance today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The benefit that they derive from this program is much less than the benefit that the various departments receive from their years of experience, their pleasant demeanor, and obvious love of our city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We are blessed with their contributions of time and talent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is a foundation so firm that it will not suffer hate or judgment, but will embrace understanding and justice.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At the start of my comments today, I said that civility and listening are the cornerstones of democratic discourse.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This is true for many reasons, but the primary reason is that civility and listening have the effect of erasing fear.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They erase the fears which feed bigotry and racism.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They level all playing fields to ensure that inequality and entitlement will not prevail.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Medford embraces the ideals of equality in so many ways through the big table led by Reverend Wendy, community coalition, the Medford Health Matters conversations.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We endeavor by action to continually make Medford a better and welcoming community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And as I look out, I see advisors, directors, and students from our CCSR program, which stands for Center for Citizenship and Social Responsibility.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They have committed their time and talents to form themselves as global citizens and thus make Medford a place of responsibility, invitation, and inclusivity.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The students are our future leaders and I could not be prouder of you today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So this day, I say again, happy new year.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Let us begin anew, filled with optimism, hope, and a sense of pride in our community, our city, our Medford, to plan its future and to bring the plan into reality.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It starts today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: May God bless you, your families, and God bless this precious city of Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you very much.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The regular meeting of the Medford School Committee will now come to order.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The secretary will call the roll.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Present, seven present, none absent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All please rise and salute our flag.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Welcome, Justin.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're very proud to have with us tonight members of the Met Republic Schools Fine Arts Department, the holiday music presentation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Take it away, maestro.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Van der Kloot.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you so much.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All right, is there anyone else?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Madam Chair, if I could just make just a quick comment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I've gotten to meet several of the groups.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the passion that you've all shown when you're talking about what you've selected to bring to the rest of the school year has been amazing.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And also the cross.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: grades.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So it's not just all seniors working together.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I've seen seniors and freshmen and just a whole mix that's really been refreshing.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I want to thank you all.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I know your advisors are fabulous.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I'm just really, really proud of all of you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Burke, will you withdraw?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Christine, could you just explain where in the policy the three meals for middle and high school and five for elementary are?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Because I'm having trouble.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I was struggling to find that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yeah.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Right.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's not.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The policy states is that if you reach zero, you're not allowed to get a la carte items such as a second entree or an additional beverage or snack.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Correct.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That you can't get extra stuff.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Right.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Correct.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Committee of the Whole, Minutes from November 27th, 2017.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This was a meeting that we held last week in order to discuss the succession plan for our superintendent of schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We had the Mass.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Association of School Committees present.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He presented quite a brochure to us on strategies that we should use in our deliberations.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ultimately, the Medford School Committee voted on the following matters in Committee of the Whole.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: that the MASC, Mass Associated School Committee, will provide a sample brochure to us.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The school committee will also explore other search consultants before making a selection.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The school committee voted to review internal candidates first.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That was a seven to zero vote.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the school committee voted to meet again on December 11, 2017 to continue its work.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also had quite a bit of discussion around a search committee if we ultimately do go outside.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: What was explained to us is if we do internal candidates,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It would be school committee interviewing in a public session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If from there we go to a full search, a nationwide search, let's say, we would form a committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the complement of that committee would be set up of three teachers from the different levels of schooling, one administrator, one student, school committee members, suggested was three,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: and also community members being parents.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we also wanted to make sure that we included all subgroups such as special ed and ELL in those check boxes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we're working on an actual application.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For those out there, we're working on a formal application that people can fill out and submit back to us if they have an interest.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Also, I ask that our diversity director be a member of this committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was voted on in seven to zero, so thank you all for that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we will be meeting next week to discuss this further on December 11th.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent, is that up here?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That is in the high school.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a motion to accept this report and place it on file?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to accept the report and place it on file.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So June 6th, all those parents out there, at 6 p.m.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to approve by Mr. Benedetto, seconded by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those opposed?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Aye.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those opposed?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Okay, thank you, Kirsten.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Item number three, report on bilingual education legislation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Item five, recommendation to approve Rick revised field trip policy, Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Van der Kloot.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: About prior payment for the trip.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So they have to.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Right, but you'd come before you do the deposit.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Because the wording is already in here, it seems like, under E. I wouldn't distinguish between out of country or in.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Just pride of payment means, well, they book it, they have to get approval from us.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And then if there's an extreme emergency, or it comes up really short notice, like the bulls came up very short notice, then that's different.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Are there any other suggestions at this point, Paulette?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I just had one note too.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I'm asking to table this until we have the complete amendment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Well, we've asked for an amendment as well.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So when you bring back the amendment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Okay.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So you want a motion to approve subject to the amendment that we just drafted?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Over time as well.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Which is scary, point of information.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's two separate ones.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I would ask that we approve the policy so that we can get it out to the principals, especially at your meeting tomorrow, and then we can get the forms at our next meeting.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They need to figure out if people are even interested in going.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They have to pull their students.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If no one wants to go, they're not going to come to us and ask for approval.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Committee of the Whole minutes from November 27th, 2017.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This was a meeting that we held last week in order to discuss the succession plan for our superintendent of schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We had the Mass Association of School Committees present.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He presented quite a brochure to us on strategies that we should use in our deliberations.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ultimately, the Medford School Committee voted on the following matters in Committee of the Whole.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: that the MASC, Mass Associated School Committee, will provide a sample brochure to us.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The school committee will also explore other search consultants before making a selection.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The school committee voted to review internal candidates first.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That was a seven to zero vote.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the school committee voted to meet again on December 11th, 2017 to continue its work.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also had quite a bit of discussion around a search committee if we ultimately do go outside.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: What was explained to us is if we do internal candidates,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It would be school committee interviewing in a public session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If from there we go to a full search, a nationwide search, let's say, we would form a committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the complement of that committee would be set up of three teachers from the different levels of schooling.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: one administrator, one student, school committee members, suggested was three, and also community members being parents.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we also wanted to make sure that we included all subgroups such as special ed and ELL in those check boxes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we're working on an actual application.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For those out there, we're working on a formal application that people can fill out and submit back to us if they have an interest.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Also, I ask that our diversity director be a member of this committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was voted on in a seven to zero, so thank you all for that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we will be meeting next week to discuss this further on December 11th.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent, is that up here?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: That is in the high school.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a motion to accept this report and place it on file?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to accept the report and place it on file.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those in favor?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Pretty much?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yeah.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It would be school committee interviewing in a public session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: 50 years now?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: 23 as our superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's somewhere in there, and he pulls it out.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We know that we will find someone that will do things differently and maybe

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: ignite the school system in a different way.
